issue.title: Enhancements to masking results of scans

labels.name: v2
labels.description: ThreatMapper revamp based on neo4j integration

issue.body:
If we mask a cve / secret in one image and then scan the image again, in the new scan it won't be masked.

All future scans of that image / host should have that cve / secret masked.

---
**Old:**

**Additional context**
We need to enhance the masking feature of secret scan results & malware scan results


**Describe the solution you'd like**
Currently, when a vulnerability scan result is masked, we can mask it within scans of the same image, or scans across multiple images. We need bring a similar workflow for secrets & malware scans too

commits.message: added masking and unmaksing for host, pending for image
update masking/unmasking with enum type changes

Merge pull request #1695 from deepfence/ui-fix-1124

Updated mask/unmask action for an image, image tags, host, across host and images

issue.title: helm install fails on EKS

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: Indicates that issue is not yet triaged and assigned

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
trying to install threatmapper v2 on EKS with terraform

but i get this error from my terraform output:
```
Error: unable to build kubernetes objects from release manifest: error validating "": error validating data: [unknown object type "nil" in Secret.stringData.AWS_ACCESS_KE
Y, unknown object type "nil" in Secret.stringData.AWS_SECRET_KEY, unknown object type "nil" in Secret.stringData.DF_S3_BUCKET_NAME]
│ 
│   with helm_release.deepfence-console[0],
│   on helm_releases.tf line 54, in resource "helm_release" "deepfence-console":
│   54: resource "helm_release" "deepfence-console" {
```
this is my tf resource. based off [ref](https://community.deepfence.io/threatmapper/docs/console/kubernetes#install-the-threatmapper-management-console):
```
resource "helm_release" "deepfence-console" {
  count      = var.threatmapper_enabled == true ? 1 : 0
  name       = "deepfence-console"
  namespace  = kubernetes_namespace.operations-namespace.id
  repository = "https://deepfence-helm-charts.s3.amazonaws.com/threatmapper"
  chart      = "deepfence-console"
  version    = "2.0.1"
  set {
    name  = "global.imageTag"
    value = "2.0.0"
  }
  set {
    name  = "global.storageClass"
    value = "gp3"
  }
}
```

my versions:
- eks 1.24
- terraform 1.4.6
  - helm provider 2.5.1

issue.title: Enhancements to masking results of scans

labels.name: v2
labels.description: ThreatMapper revamp based on neo4j integration

issue.body:
If we mask a cve / secret in one image and then scan the image again, in the new scan it won't be masked.

All future scans of that image / host should have that cve / secret masked.

---
**Old:**

**Additional context**
We need to enhance the masking feature of secret scan results & malware scan results


**Describe the solution you'd like**
Currently, when a vulnerability scan result is masked, we can mask it within scans of the same image, or scans across multiple images. We need bring a similar workflow for secrets & malware scans too

comment.body:
@manV @milan-deepfence As discussed, I have modified the request to use enums instead of the above. 
For this, we will have the following enums:
**mask_global** : This is to mask gobally. (same as previous mask_across_hosts_and_images flag)
**mask_all_image_tag**: This is to mask for all tags of an image. 
**mask_entity**: This is to mask for an entity other than container/container image. E.g. Host. 
**mask_image_tag**: This is to apply mask for an image and tag. 

We will need to send these enums in the request param as follows:
`mask_action: "<mask_enum>"`. E.g.  `mask_action: "mask_global"`

Also, I have removed the `mask_across_hosts_and_images` flag from the request. We will be using the `mask_global` enum instead.

commits.message: ISSUE-1124-3: Simplifying the api using enums

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -128,12 +128,10 @@ type CloudComplianceScanListResp struct {
 }
 
 type ScanResultsMaskRequest struct {
-	ScanID                   string   `json:"scan_id" validate:"required" required:"true"`
-	ResultIDs                []string `json:"result_ids" validate:"required,gt=0,dive,min=1" required:"true"`
-	ScanType                 string   `json:"scan_type" validate:"required,oneof=SecretScan VulnerabilityScan MalwareScan ComplianceScan CloudComplianceScan" required:"true" enum:"SecretScan,VulnerabilityScan,MalwareScan,ComplianceScan,CloudComplianceScan"`
-	MaskAcrossHostsAndImages bool     `json:"mask_across_hosts_and_images"`
-	MaskAcrossImageTags      bool     `json:"mask_in_this_host_or_image_tags"`
-	MaskForImageTag          bool     `json:"mask_in_this_image_tag"`
+	ScanID     string   `json:"scan_id" validate:"required" required:"true"`
+	ResultIDs  []string `json:"result_ids" validate:"required,gt=0,dive,min=1" required:"true"`
+	ScanType   string   `json:"scan_type" validate:"required,oneof=SecretScan VulnerabilityScan MalwareScan ComplianceScan CloudComplianceScan" required:"true" enum:"SecretScan,VulnerabilityScan,MalwareScan,ComplianceScan,CloudComplianceScan"`
+	MaskAction string   `json:"mask_action" validate:"required,oneof=mask_across_hosts_and_images mask_across_image_tags mask_for_entity mask_for_image_tag" required:"true" enum:"mask_across_hosts_and_images,mask_across_image_tags,mask_for_entity,mask_for_image_tag"`
comment.body:
Let have the following enums:
- mask globally
- mask specific entity
- mask specific image tag
- mask all tags
